comments.author: CountArtha

comments.text:
They're pretty ignorant about the 17th century... no one thought that the 
earth was flat at that point. People barely even thought it to begin with 
(the idea that Columbus set out to disprove it is a myth). Also, the 17th 
century was already the tail end of the Renaissance... people then were 
wrong about many things, sure, but they established the basis for modern 
society, and some of the most brilliant people the world has ever seen 
lived during that time or long before. They're thinking the Middle Ages 
(even the video says "Medieval"), which was a full 300 years previous. I'm 
sorry! That was just bugging me. This is still hilarious.﻿

comments.text:
First of all, the people at Buzzfeed are feminists. So you know that these 
are the exact same people who say things like women are expected to do this 
and be this way. That is how a lot of their complaints go. If you know 
anything about feminism you know that. Second thing I want to say is that 
all of them are fucking hypocrites. Coming from the same people who say 
that women shouldn't be generalize you hear "Oh yeah right! There's no way 
18% of men don't masturbate" and "Well this means that 18% of men are 
fucking liars!!" This bothers me because the men are basically saying "Oh 
hell naw!!! I'm weak and can't control myself so I know that you're the 
same way!! I'm a chronic masturbator so I know every man must be chronic 
masturbators. And for the women to think this way is even worst IMO because 
they act like the know what the urge is like. They talk like they are men. 
Also you hear a lot of women saying "eww" to masturbation, so this means 
that they think that all men are disgusting. Buzzfeed feminists are the 
biggest hypocrites. When I was a sophomore in high school, there was a girl 
who I made some sort of deal with. I forgot what it was, but when I reached 
out to shake on the deal she told me "oh no. I don't shake guys' hands 
because at this moment in life they masturbate." I'm chuckled and said "no. 
I don't do that shit." Then she argued with me up and down just saying 
things like "why don't you just admit it. I KNOW you're lying." The key 
word being "know." She was sexist because she just treat men this way as if 
women can't masturbate, and because she generalized the entire male gender. 
Just as Buzzfeed did. I can't be the only one who notices this.﻿
